person.persName: William Riley Hopper (Nicholas County, Kentucky, blacksmith and soldier.)

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, blacksmith and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Alfred Hopper and Hannah Riley Hopper. Married to Margaret Everman Hopper in Nicholas County, Kentucky, on April 3, 1860. Father of Theodosia Hopper and Arthur E. Hopper. Blacksmith in Nicholas County in 1860. Enrolled in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a farrier on August 30, 1862. Captured by Confederate forces prior to being mustered in and paroled at Cynthiana, Kentucky. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and farrier from January 26, 1863 to May 20, 1863. Discharged for physical disability on May 20, 1863 in Nashville, Tennessee.
